meanings.definition: The state or quality of being severe.
meanings.sent1: The severities of winter made it difficult to go outside.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's severity surprised the students.
meanings.sent3: The severity of the punishment for being late was having to clean the entire classroom.
meanings.sent4: The severity of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The severity of the judge's gaze made the defendant nervous.

meanings.definition: A severe or harsh act or instance.
meanings.sent1: The severities of the dictator were well-known.
meanings.sent2: The severity of the scolding left a lasting impact on the child.
meanings.sent3: The severity of the chef's critique of the dish was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The severity of the earthquake shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The severity of the injury required immediate medical attention.
